subject: Technology
title: The First Website Ever
description: A quick, practical guide to The First Website Ever.

hook.text: On August 6, 1991, the first website went live. It was a plain page of text with blue links.

buildup.text: Hosted on Berners-Lee's computer at CERN, it explained what the World Wide Web was.

discovery.text: The page had no images, no colors, no design. Just text explaining how hyperlinks worked.

twist.text: That first site was nearly lost forever. CERN only restored it in 2013 after realizing its value.

climax.text: You can still visit info.cern.ch today. It looks exactly as it did in 1991.

punchline.text: The first website taught the world what a website was.

quiz.question: What was the first website about?
options: A description of the World Wide Web itself
